skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, PubChem, Reactome, QuickGO. Unified API for queries, ID mapping, pathway analysis. For direct REST control, use individual database skills (uniprot-database, kegg-database).
skill.summary: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill ships executable Python scripts that call external bioinformatics services and write output files. No environment access or external command execution is present. Risk is limited to user-initiated network queries and local file reads and writes.

content.value_statement: You need reliable access to many bioinformatics databases without custom API code. This skill provides ready workflows for queries, mapping, and pathway analysis.
actual_capabilities: Search UniProt and retrieve FASTA sequences
Run BLASTP similarity searches via NCBIblast
Discover KEGG pathways for a protein and list pathway names
Map identifiers in batches with UniProt mapping and CSV output
Cross reference compounds across KEGG, ChEBI, and ChEMBL
limitations: Requires network access to external bioinformatics services
BLAST requires a valid email address and can be slow
Scripts require the bioservices Python package to be installed
Pathway analysis writes output files to disk

use_cases.title: Protein analysis workflow
use_cases.description: Retrieve a protein sequence, run BLAST, and list related KEGG pathways in one workflow.

use_cases.title: Compound ID mapping
use_cases.description: Map a KEGG compound to ChEBI and ChEMBL identifiers for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Teaching pipeline demo
use_cases.description: Demonstrate a multi database bioinformatics pipeline using ready scripts and clear outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Find a protein
prompt_templates.prompt: Find a UniProt entry for ZAP70_HUMAN and summarize the organism, gene names, and sequence length.

prompt_templates.title: Run BLAST
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a BLASTP search for this sequence and summarize the top hits and organism distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: Find KEGG pathways linked to UniProt ID P43403 and list the pathway names.

prompt_templates.title: Batch convert IDs
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a list of IDs
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a batch of UniProt accessions to KEGG IDs and save a CSV mapping file.

output_examples.input: Summarize KEGG pathways for the human ZAP70 protein.
output: Mapped ZAP70 to KEGG gene hsa:7535
Found pathways: T cell receptor signaling, B cell receptor signaling, NF-kappa B signaling

best_practices: Provide specific database codes and identifiers
Use the limit option for large pathway scans
Store outputs in a dedicated folder per run
anti_patterns: Do not pass sensitive data in query strings
Do not assume all IDs will map successfully
Do not run BLAST without a valid email address

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code when the bioservices Python package is available.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: External services may rate limit requests, so use chunking and delays for large batches.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The scripts produce CSV and SIF files that can feed downstream analysis tools.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to external bioinformatics services, and output files are saved locally.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check network access, verify IDs, and retry with smaller batches or the limit option.

faq.question: How does it compare to single database skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on multi database workflows and cross references instead of single service control.
